title: Expert Traveler Accessories Announces New Pocketsize Luggage Scale
text:
July 14, 2015 - San Francisco, CA -- Expert Traveler Accessories is very pleased to announce that the newly designed Digital pocket scale is now available on Amazon.
Amazon, one of the largest online shopping websites in the world, is so committed to Customer Service it has won the trust of not only Sellers but Buyers alike.
"Expert Traveler Accessories is very excited to present this new innovation to the Amazon community", said company spokesperson, Rose Ilton.
" The new Ergonomic design supplied in distinctive packaging includes
 * An In-built one meter measuring tape
 * Overload Warning Indicator light
 * Spirit Level to ensure that you get a correct reading every time
 * LCD Display
 * 110lb/50kg Capacity
 * Wrapped in a fashionable Brushed Stainless steel casing.
 * 2 x AAA Batteries Included
 * Easily interpreted Instruction leaflet enclosed.
Customers won't have to waste their hard earned holiday spending money on last minute Excess Luggage Fees with this handy compact device", said Rose.
Carry-On luggage often poses the most drama for the air passenger. Having a "Packing Checklist", as below, will often alleviate some of these issues. James Brian,Sales Consultant with the company recommends the following tips for travelers.
"Firstly divide your list into the following suggested headings
Paperwork- Tickets ,passport etc
Toiletries- Essentials, Medicine,deodorant,toothbrush etc
Electronics- phone,laptop, chargers, cords etc
Gear-Earplugs, pen, Book, Notepaper, water bottle etc
Clothes-Consider day to day activities starting from the time you rise.
Outerwear- Jacket, Wear don't pack heavy clothes.
Tops- T-shirts x4 , Long Sleeve shirt x 2
Bottoms- 2 pairs pants/skirts or shorts
Underwear 6 pairs - Personal Choice.
Shoes- 1 pair
Accessories 2 pairs socks
The next suggestion is then to go through your Bag again and try and halve the contents. You might be very surprised. If in doubt you can always purchase light weight gear whilst you are on your trip. Last but not least", says James, "Dont forget to pack your Luggage Checklist! "
